alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 10:56PM EST until March 04 at 4:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Indiana... Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier affecting Williams County. North Branch Elkhart River at Cosperville affecting Noble County. Saint Joseph River Ohio near Newville affecting De Kalb, Defiance and Allen IN Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Defiance, Fulton OH and Williams Counties. .Recent rains and thunderstorms with periods of heavy rain has created excess runoff that will create minor river flooding through the week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saint Joseph River Ohio below Montpelier. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, County Road K, one mile southwest of Montpelier begins to flood. Some flooding begins to affect the village of Pioneer. Significant low land and agricultural flooding occurs near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 12.9 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
